thread.title: Mom, son indicted in murder

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Mom, son indicted in murder
text:
A Rochester mother and son, already accused of a Norton Street murder, were indicted by a grand jury. Jacqueline Staples, 48, and James McCracken, 28, face charges of first-degree murder, two counts of second-degree murder, and first-degree robbery for the Sept. 10 killing of Robert Pinckney, 66.
Rochester Police arrested McCracken and Staples on Sept. 22 and charged them with second-degree murder. They will be arraigned on the new charges at 1:30 p.m. on Thursday.
Video shows images of the two "leaving the scene of the murder and shortly thereafter with property taken from the victim," Rochester Police Investigator David Simpson stated in a criminal complaint.
The two allegedly killed Pinckney shortly before midnight "by causing him multiple blunt force and sharp force injuries," according to the criminal complaint.
WCLEVELAND@Gannett.com
